title: Chicken Tikka Masala
instructions: Marinate chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, and half the spices.
Let it marinate for 30 minutes.
Heat oil, add onions and sauté until golden.
Add tomatoes and cook until mushy.
Add remaining spices and cook until oil separates.
Add marinated chicken and cook until tender.
Add cream and simmer for 5 minutes. Serve hot.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: North Indian Curry Masters

title: Dal Makhani
instructions: Soak dals overnight, pressure cook until soft.
Heat butter, add onions and sauté until golden.
Add tomatoes and cook until mushy.
Add ginger-garlic paste and spices.
Add cooked dals and mix well.
Simmer for 30 minutes, add cream.
Serve hot with rice or naan.

title: Palak Paneer
instructions: Blanch spinach leaves and grind to paste.
Heat oil, add onions and sauté until golden.
Add tomatoes and cook until mushy.
Add ginger-garlic paste and spices.
Add spinach paste and cook for 5 minutes.
Add paneer cubes and cream.
Simmer for 5 minutes and serve hot.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: North Indian Vegetarian Masters

title: Butter Chicken
instructions: Marinate chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, and spices.
Let it marinate for 30 minutes.
Heat butter, add onions and sauté until golden.
Add tomatoes and cook until mushy.
Add marinated chicken and cook until tender.
Add cream and simmer for 5 minutes.
Serve hot with naan or rice.

title: Chole Bhature
ingredients: For bhature: 2 cups maida, 1/2 cup yogurt, 1 tsp sugar, salt, oil for frying
instructions: Pressure cook chickpeas until soft.
Heat oil, add onions and sauté until golden.
Add tomatoes and cook until mushy.
Add ginger-garlic paste and spices.
Add cooked chickpeas and simmer for 20 minutes.
For bhature: Mix maida, yogurt, sugar, salt, and water.
Make soft dough, roll and deep fry until puffed.

title: Rajma Chawal
instructions: Soak rajma overnight, pressure cook until soft.
Heat oil, add onions and sauté until golden.
Add tomatoes and cook until mushy.
Add ginger-garlic paste and spices.
Add cooked rajma and simmer for 20 minutes.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: North Indian Comfort Food

title: Aloo Gobi
instructions: Heat oil, add onions and sauté until golden.
Add tomatoes and cook until mushy.
Add ginger-garlic paste and spices.
Add potatoes and cook for 5 minutes.
Add cauliflower and cook until tender.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: North Indian Vegetable Specialists

title: Fish Curry (Goan Style)
instructions: Marinate fish with turmeric and salt for 15 minutes.
Heat coconut oil, add onions and sauté until golden.
Add tomatoes and cook until mushy.
Add spice powders and cook until oil separates.
Add coconut milk and bring to gentle boil.
Add fish pieces and cook until fish is tender.
Garnish with curry leaves and serve hot.

title: Pav Bhaji
instructions: Boil and mash potatoes and mixed vegetables.
Heat butter, add onions and sauté until golden.
Add tomatoes and cook until mushy.
Add ginger-garlic paste and spices.
Add mashed vegetables and cook for 10 minutes.
Serve hot with buttered pav bread.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: Mumbai Street Food Masters

title: Chicken Curry (North Indian Style)
instructions: Marinate chicken with turmeric and salt for 30 minutes.
Heat oil, add onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add tomatoes and cook until mushy.
Add ginger-garlic paste and spices.
Add marinated chicken and cook until tender.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: North Indian Curry Masters
